datasets.name: data.csv
datasets.description: Related to hackathons, coding challenges, and programming contests.

columns.name: gdp_per_capita
columns.description: Gross Domestic Product per capita (in USD)

columns.name: age
columns.description: Age of the participant

columns.name: percentage_population_internet_access
columns.description: Percentage of the country's population that has access to the internet

columns.name: public_wifi_hotspots
columns.description: Number of public WiFi hotspots available in urban areas of the country

columns.name: technical_university_graduates
columns.description: Number of university graduates in technical studies like computer science, engineering, etc., per year.

columns.name: major_universities_cs
columns.description: Whether the country has major universities offering computer science programs

columns.name: digital_infrastructure_investment
columns.description: Amount of public and private investment in digital infrastructure in the participant's country

columns.name: previous_contest_rank_percentile
columns.description: Percentile ranking of the participant based on previous contest performances

columns.name: country
columns.description: The country from which a participant originates

columns.name: tech_interest
columns.description: Average interest in technology topics among the population, scaled from 1 to 10

columns.name: number_of_webinars_attended
columns.description: Number of coding-related webinars the participant has attended in the past year

columns.name: entrepreneurship_index
columns.description: Binomial index indicating high(1) or low(0) entrepreneurship conducive environment in the participant's country

columns.name: club_global_affiliation
columns.description: Indicates if the local programming club is affiliated with a global coding community

columns.name: has_full_time_non_coding_job
columns.description: Indicates if the participant has a full-time job that does not involve coding

columns.name: internet_speed
columns.description: Average internet speed in the participant's country measured in Mbps

columns.name: has_critical_tech_cluster
columns.description: Indicates if the country has a critical mass of technology innovation clusters

columns.name: local_club_participation
columns.description: Indicates if the participant is a member of a local programming club

columns.name: cs_degree_universities
columns.description: Indicator of whether the participant's country has renowned universities offering computer science degrees

columns.name: tech_related_patent_filings
columns.description: Number of patent filings related to technology annually

columns.name: number_of_engineering_graduates
columns.description: Total number of engineering graduates annually

columns.name: tech_degree_percentage
columns.description: Percentage of technology-related degrees out of all degrees awarded annually

columns.name: junior_coders
columns.description: Number of coders with less than 5 years of experience in the participant's country

columns.name: coding_proficiency_level
columns.description: Self-rated coding proficiency level of the participant

columns.name: stem_higher_education_rate
columns.description: Percentage of the population with higher education degrees in STEM fields in the participant's country

columns.name: rapid_digital_transformation
columns.description: Binary indicator of whether the country has undergone rapid digital transformation in the past decade

columns.name: predicted_number_of_tech_companies
columns.description: Expected count of technology companies in the participant's country

columns.name: top_20_innovation_index
columns.description: Indicates if the country is among the top 20 in global innovation indices

columns.name: average_stem_score
columns.description: Average score of students in STEM fields from the country's major universities

columns.name: weekly_problem_solving_sessions
columns.description: The number of problem-solving sessions attended by the participant per week

columns.name: government_investment_in_tech
columns.description: Amount of money invested by the government in technology sector annually (in millions USD)

columns.name: tech_startup_investment
columns.description: Total investment received by tech startups in millions USD per year.

columns.name: modern_tech_education_practices
columns.description: Whether the country has implemented modern educational practices in teaching technology (yes/no).

columns.name: internet_users_percentage
columns.description: Percentage of the population in the participant's country that uses the internet

columns.name: internet_education_programs
columns.description: Binary indicator of whether the country has active internet education programs

columns.name: tech_startups
columns.description: Number of tech startups in the participant's country

columns.name: programming_courses_completed
columns.description: The number of programming courses the participant has completed.

columns.name: coding_bootcamps
columns.description: Number of coding bootcamps in the participant's country

columns.name: programming_language
columns.description: The programming language used by the participant

columns.name: high_speed_internet_access
columns.description: Percentage of population with access to high-speed internet

columns.name: practice_hours_per_week
columns.description: Average number of hours per week the participant practices coding

columns.name: tech_companies_using_advanced_tech
columns.description: Number of tech companies in the participant's country using advanced programming technologies

columns.name: access_to_advanced_resources
columns.description: Indicates if the participant has access to advanced coding resources such as latest software tools and platforms

columns.name: political_stability
columns.description: A numeric score representing the political stability of the country

columns.name: participation_duration_years
columns.description: The number of years the participant has been participating in coding competitions.

columns.name: high_digital_consumption
columns.description: Binary value indicating if the country has high digital content and service consumption

columns.name: collaborative_projects_frequency
columns.description: The frequency of collaborative projects the participant is involved in per month.

columns.name: senior_coders
columns.description: Number of coders with more than 10 years of experience in the participant's country

queries.question: Is there a relationship between the number of junior coders in a country and the product of the entrepreneurship index, coding bootcamps, and tech startups in that country?
queries.true_hypothesis: The number of junior coders can be predicted by the number of coding bootcamps and tech startups in a participant’s country, particularly significant in countries with a high entrepreneurship index, where the number of junior coders is proportional to 50 times the number of coding bootcamps plus the number of tech startups plus half the product of the entrepreneurship index, tech startups, and tech startups.
